intro: Cremosperma occidentale, commonly known as western creamroot, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a perennial herb characterized by its yellow flowers and milky sap. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is found in arid and semi-arid regions. Its leaves are alternate and often have a waxy coating to reduce water loss. The species is part of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is known for its aromatic properties.
